dcterms:creator: Mausam
Michael Schmitz
Stephen Soderland
Robert Bart
Oren Etzioni
dcterms:description: The New York Times Gigaword Corpus is used to extract event triples for training the event representation model, filtering events with frequencies less than 3, resulting in 4,029,877 distinct events.
dcterms:title: New York Times Gigaword Corpus

dcterms:creator: I-Ta Lee
Dan Goldwasser
dcterms:description: The MCNC dataset is used for the transfer task to evaluate script knowledge, requiring a reasoning system to distinguish the next event from a set of randomly drawn events.
dcterms:title: MCNC dataset

dcterms:creator: Noah Weber
Niranjan Balasubramanian
Nathanael Chambers
dcterms:description: The Hard Similarity Task Dataset is used to evaluate whether the event representation model can push away representations of dissimilar events while pulling together those of similar events.
dcterms:title: Hard Similarity Task Dataset

dcterms:creator: Dimitri Kartsaklis
Mehrnoosh Sadrzadeh
dcterms:description: The Transitive Sentence Similarity Dataset contains pairs of transitive sentences that are manually annotated by a similarity score, used to evaluate the similarity of event representations.
dcterms:title: Transitive Sentence Similarity Dataset

dcterms:creator: Noah Weber
Niranjan Balasubramanian
Nathanael Chambers
dcterms:description: The Extended Hard Similarity Task Dataset is an extension of the original dataset, containing more event pairs for evaluating the performance of event representation models.
dcterms:title: Extended Hard Similarity Task Dataset
